articles.headline: CVS Settles Prescription Price Case
articles.snippet: The pharmacy benefits manager agreed to pay $5 million to settle charges by the Federal Trade Commission that the company had misrepresented the price of certain prescription drugs in one of its Medicare drug plans.
articles.abstract: The pharmacy benefits manager agreed to pay $5 million to settle charges by the Federal Trade Commission that the company had misrepresented the price of certain prescription drugs in one of its Medicare drug plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: After more than two years of investigation, CVS Caremark agreed on Thursday to pay $5 million to settle charges by the Federal Trade Commission that the company had misrepresented the price of certain prescription drugs in one of its Medicare drug plans, causing many older consumers to pay significantly higher prices than advertised.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Natasha Singer

articles.headline: Born in Unity, South Sudan Is Torn Again
articles.snippet: Bitter ethnic tensions that were set aside in pursuit of independence have ruptured into a cycle of massacre and revenge.
articles.abstract: Bitter ethnic tensions that were set aside in pursuit of independence have ruptured into a cycle of massacre and revenge.
articles.lead_paragraph: PIBOR, South Sudan — The trail of corpses begins about 300 yards from the corrugated metal gate of the United Nations compound and stretches for miles into the bush.

articles.headline: Greek Yogurt a Boon for New York State
articles.snippet: Sales of Greek yogurt are booming, and leading brands are expanding their operations, and the production jobs they entail, in the state.
articles.abstract: Sales of Greek yogurt are booming, and leading brands are expanding their operations, and the production jobs they entail, in the state.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sales of Greek yogurt are booming, benefiting from a perception that the food is healthier than regular yogurt and other snacks.

articles.headline: Inside the Fed in 2006: A Coming Crisis, and Banter
articles.snippet: Top policy makers did not seriously consider the idea that problems in the housing market would bring a recession, newly released transcripts show.
articles.abstract: Top policy makers did not seriously consider the idea that problems in the housing market would bring a recession, newly released transcripts show.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the housing bubble entered its waning hours in 2006, top Federal Reserve officials marveled at the desperate antics of home builders seeking to lure buyers.

articles.headline: U.S. Sends Top Iranian Leader a Warning on Strait Threat
articles.snippet: The administration has warned Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, that closing the Strait of Hormuz is a “red line” that would provoke a response, officials said.
articles.abstract: The administration has warned Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, that closing the Strait of Hormuz is a “red line” that would provoke a response, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration is relying on a secret channel of communication to warn Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, that closing the Strait of Hormuz is a “red line” that would provoke an American response, according to United States government officials.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller, Eric Schmitt and Thom Shanker

articles.headline: U.S. Restores Full Ties to Myanmar After Rapid Reforms
articles.snippet: The action is a diplomatic reward for recent political reforms by Myanmar’s civilian government, including the release of top activists on Friday.
articles.abstract: The action is a diplomatic reward for recent political reforms by Myanmar’s civilian government, including the release of top activists on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States moved to restore full diplomatic relations with Myanmar on Friday, rewarding the sweeping political and economic changes that the country’s new civilian government has made, including a cease-fire with ethnic rebels and, only hours before, the release of hundreds of political prisoners.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Seth Mydans

articles.headline: Obama Bid to Cut the Government Tests Congress
articles.snippet: The president announced a new campaign to shrink the federal government, a proposal notable less for its goal than for its challenge to a hostile Congress.
articles.abstract: The president announced a new campaign to shrink the federal government, a proposal notable less for its goal than for its challenge to a hostile Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama on Friday announced an aggressive campaign to shrink the size of the federal government, a proposal less notable for its goal — the fight against bloat has been embraced by every modern-day president — than for the political challenge it poses to a hostile Congress.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Annie Lowrey
